channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Unsupervised Domain Adaption Harnessing Vision-Language Pre-training
item.description: To address this, we propose a novel method called Cross-Modal Knowledge Distillation (CMKD), leveraging VLP models as teacher models to guide the learning process in the target domain, resulting in state-of-the-art performance.

item.title: EuSQuAD: Automatically Translated and Aligned SQuAD2.0 for Basque
item.description: The widespread availability of Question Answering (QA) datasets in English has greatly facilitated the advancement of the Natural Language Processing (NLP) field.

item.title: Advancing the Robustness of Large Language Models through Self-Denoised Smoothing
item.description: Although large language models (LLMs) have achieved significant success, their vulnerability to adversarial perturbations, including recent jailbreak attacks, has raised considerable concerns.

item.title: LongEmbed: Extending Embedding Models for Long Context Retrieval
item.description: This paper explores context window extension of existing embedding models, pushing the limit to 32k without requiring additional training.

item.title: Harnessing Joint Rain-/Detail-aware Representations to Eliminate Intricate Rains
item.description: By integrating CoI-M with the rain-/detail-aware Contrastive learning, we develop CoIC, an innovative and potent algorithm tailored for training models on mixed datasets.

item.title: Sharing Parameter by Conjugation for Knowledge Graph Embeddings in Complex Space
item.description: A Knowledge Graph (KG) is the directed graphical representation of entities and relations in the real world.

item.title: Expected Coordinate Improvement for High-Dimensional Bayesian Optimization
item.description: The greatest advantage of the proposed ECI-BO (expected coordinate improvement based Bayesian optimization) algorithm over the standard BO algorithm is that the infill selection problem of the proposed algorithm is always a one-dimensional problem thus can be easily solved.

item.title: Sketch-guided Image Inpainting with Partial Discrete Diffusion Process
item.description: In this work, we study the task of sketch-guided image inpainting.

item.title: Internet sentiment exacerbates intraday overtrading, evidence from A-Share market
item.description: Additionally, the effect of sentiment on overtrading is observed to be more pronounced among individual investors in large-cap stocks compared to small- and mid-cap stocks.

item.title: TriForce: Lossless Acceleration of Long Sequence Generation with Hierarchical Speculative Decoding
item.description: However, key-value (KV) cache, which is stored to avoid re-computation, has emerged as a critical bottleneck by growing linearly in size with the sequence length.

item.title: MolCRAFT: Structure-Based Drug Design in Continuous Parameter Space
item.description: Generative models for structure-based drug design (SBDD) have shown promising results in recent years.

item.title: Concept Induction: Analyzing Unstructured Text with High-Level Concepts Using LLooM
item.description: Data analysts have long sought to turn unstructured text data into meaningful concepts.

item.title: Token-level Direct Preference Optimization
item.description: Fine-tuning pre-trained Large Language Models (LLMs) is essential to align them with human values and intentions.

item.title: Partial Large Kernel CNNs for Efficient Super-Resolution
item.description: As a result, we introduce Partial Large Kernel CNNs for Efficient Super-Resolution (PLKSR), which achieves state-of-the-art performance on four datasets at a scale of $\times$4, with reductions of 68. 1\% in latency and 80. 2\% in maximum GPU memory occupancy compared to SRFormer-light.

item.title: CMNEE: A Large-Scale Document-Level Event Extraction Dataset based on Open-Source Chinese Military News
item.description: To alleviate this problem, we propose CMNEE, a large-scale, document-level open-source Chinese Military News Event Extraction dataset.

item.title: GraFIQs: Face Image Quality Assessment Using Gradient Magnitudes
item.description: We propose in this work a novel approach to assess the quality of face images based on inspecting the required changes in the pre-trained FR model weights to minimize differences between testing samples and the distribution of the FR training dataset.

item.title: Seeing Motion at Nighttime with an Event Camera
item.description: In this work, we present a novel nighttime dynamic imaging method with an event camera.

item.title: X-Light: Cross-City Traffic Signal Control Using Transformer on Transformer as Meta Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learner
item.description: The effectiveness of traffic light control has been significantly improved by current reinforcement learning-based approaches via better cooperation among multiple traffic lights.

item.title: MaskCD: A Remote Sensing Change Detection Network Based on Mask Classification
item.description: Change detection (CD) from remote sensing (RS) images using deep learning has been widely investigated in the literature.

item.title: S3R-Net: A Single-Stage Approach to Self-Supervised Shadow Removal
item.description: In this paper we present S3R-Net, the Self-Supervised Shadow Removal Network.

item.title: Not All Voxels Are Equal: Hardness-Aware Semantic Scene Completion with Self-Distillation
item.description: Furthermore, the voxels in the boundary region are more challenging to differentiate than those in the interior.

item.title: Self-Adjusting Evolutionary Algorithms Are Slow on Multimodal Landscapes
item.description: The one-fifth rule and its generalizations are a classical parameter control mechanism in discrete domains.

item.title: AccidentBlip2: Accident Detection With Multi-View MotionBlip2
item.description: Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs) have shown outstanding capabilities in many areas of multimodal reasoning.

item.title: From Form(s) to Meaning: Probing the Semantic Depths of Language Models Using Multisense Consistency
item.description: The staggering pace with which the capabilities of large language models (LLMs) are increasing, as measured by a range of commonly used natural language understanding (NLU) benchmarks, raises many questions regarding what "understanding" means for a language model and how it compares to human understanding.

item.title: Large Language Models in Targeted Sentiment Analysis
item.description: Reasoning capabilities of the fine-tuned Flan-T5 models with THoR achieve at least 5% increment with the base-size model compared to the results of the zero-shot experiment.

item.title: Information theory unifies atomistic machine learning, uncertainty quantification, and materials thermodynamics
item.description: An accurate description of information is relevant for a range of problems in atomistic modeling, such as sampling methods, detecting rare events, analyzing datasets, or performing uncertainty quantification (UQ) in machine learning (ML)-driven simulations.

item.title: Transformer tricks: Removing weights for skipless transformers
item.description: He and Hofmann (arXiv:2311. 01906) detailed a skipless transformer without the V and P (post-attention projection) linear layers, which reduces the total number of weights.

item.title: Exploring Boundaries and Intensities in Offensive and Hate Speech: Unveiling the Complex Spectrum of Social Media Discourse
item.description: The prevalence of digital media and evolving sociopolitical dynamics have significantly amplified the dissemination of hateful content.

item.title: 6Img-to-3D: Few-Image Large-Scale Outdoor Driving Scene Reconstruction
item.description: Current 3D reconstruction techniques struggle to infer unbounded scenes from a few images faithfully.

item.title: Moving Object Segmentation: All You Need Is SAM (and Flow)
item.description: The objective of this paper is motion segmentation -- discovering and segmenting the moving objects in a video.

item.title: OpenBezoar: Small, Cost-Effective and Open Models Trained on Mixes of Instruction Data
item.description: Evaluation is done with the LM Eval Harness tasks/metrics as well as on MT-Bench using the "LLM-as-a-judge" framework with Claude 2. 1, with the finding that the final checkpoint, "OpenBezoar-HH-RLHF-DPO", demonstrates superior performance over many models at the 3B parameter scale, even outperforming the top model in one of the categories on the Huggingface Open LLM Leaderboard.

item.title: Aligning Actions and Walking to LLM-Generated Textual Descriptions
item.description: For action recognition, we employ LLMs to generate textual descriptions of actions in the BABEL-60 dataset, facilitating the alignment of motion sequences with linguistic representations.

item.title: Data-free Knowledge Distillation for Fine-grained Visual Categorization
item.description: Our approach utilizes an adversarial distillation framework with attention generator, mixed high-order attention distillation, and semantic feature contrast learning.

item.title: The devil is in the object boundary: towards annotation-free instance segmentation using Foundation Models
item.description: Foundation models, pre-trained on a large amount of data have demonstrated impressive zero-shot capabilities in various downstream tasks.

item.title: Consisaug: A Consistency-based Augmentation for Polyp Detection in Endoscopy Image Analysis
item.description: Colorectal cancer (CRC), which frequently originates from initially benign polyps, remains a significant contributor to global cancer-related mortality.

item.title: Exploring the Transferability of Visual Prompting for Multimodal Large Language Models
item.description: To achieve this, we propose Transferable Visual Prompting (TVP), a simple and effective approach to generate visual prompts that can transfer to different models and improve their performance on downstream tasks after trained on only one model.

item.title: Domain-Specific Block Selection and Paired-View Pseudo-Labeling for Online Test-Time Adaptation
item.description: After blocks are adjusted for current test domain, we generate pseudo-labels by averaging given test images and corresponding flipped counterparts.

item.title: Decomposing and Editing Predictions by Modeling Model Computation
item.description: The goal of component modeling is to decompose an ML model's prediction in terms of its components -- simple functions (e. g., convolution filters, attention heads) that are the "building blocks" of model computation.

item.title: Group-Aware Coordination Graph for Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning
item.description: To overcome these limitations, we present a novel approach to infer the Group-Aware Coordination Graph (GACG), which is designed to capture both the cooperation between agent pairs based on current observations and group-level dependencies from behaviour patterns observed across trajectories.

item.title: Paraphrase and Solve: Exploring and Exploiting the Impact of Surface Form on Mathematical Reasoning in Large Language Models
item.description: This paper studies the relationship between the surface form of a mathematical problem and its solvability by large language models.

item.title: In-Context Learning State Vector with Inner and Momentum Optimization
item.description: In this paper, we address this gap by presenting a comprehensive analysis of these compressed vectors, drawing parallels to the parameters trained with gradient descent, and introduce the concept of state vector.

item.title: On the Causal Nature of Sentiment Analysis
item.description: Sentiment analysis (SA) aims to identify the sentiment expressed in a text, such as a product review.

item.title: FedPFT: Federated Proxy Fine-Tuning of Foundation Models
item.description: Adapting Foundation Models (FMs) for downstream tasks through Federated Learning (FL) emerges a promising strategy for protecting data privacy and valuable FMs.

item.title: Consistency Training by Synthetic Question Generation for Conversational Question Answering
item.description: In our novel model-agnostic approach, referred to as CoTaH (Consistency-Trained augmented History), we augment the historical information with synthetic questions and subsequently employ consistency training to train a model that utilizes both real and augmented historical data to implicitly make the reasoning robust to irrelevant history.

item.title: JointViT: Modeling Oxygen Saturation Levels with Joint Supervision on Long-Tailed OCTA
item.description: The oxygen saturation level in the blood (SaO2) is crucial for health, particularly in relation to sleep-related breathing disorders.

item.title: FairSSD: Understanding Bias in Synthetic Speech Detectors
item.description: In this work, we examine bias in existing synthetic speech detectors to determine if they will unfairly target a particular gender, age and accent group.

item.title: Unifying Bias and Unfairness in Information Retrieval: A Survey of Challenges and Opportunities with Large Language Models
item.description: With the rapid advancement of large language models (LLMs), information retrieval (IR) systems, such as search engines and recommender systems, have undergone a significant paradigm shift.

item.title: Inductive Cognitive Diagnosis for Fast Student Learning in Web-Based Online Intelligent Education Systems
item.description: To this end, this paper proposes an inductive cognitive diagnosis model (ICDM) for fast new students' mastery levels inference in WOIESs.

item.title: InfoMatch: Entropy Neural Estimation for Semi-Supervised Image Classification
item.description: Semi-supervised image classification, leveraging pseudo supervision and consistency regularization, has demonstrated remarkable success.

item.title: Deep Portrait Quality Assessment. A NTIRE 2024 Challenge Survey
item.description: This paper reviews the NTIRE 2024 Portrait Quality Assessment Challenge, highlighting the proposed solutions and results.
